extendedIngredients.name: almond meal
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 cup corn meal or almond meal

extendedIngredients.name: banana
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 ripe banana (The riper, the better. Bananas have lots of natural sugars!)
metaInformation: (The riper, the better. Bananas have lots of natural sugars!)

extendedIngredients.name: berries
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 cup fresh or frozen berries, your choice (I used a mix of strawberries and blueberries)
metaInformation: (I used a mix of strawberries and blueberries)

extendedIngredients.name: olive oil
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/4 cup vegetable, canola or olive oil

extendedIngredients.name: rice flour
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 cup all-purpose flour or rice flour

recipes.title: Sugar-Free Almond Berry Muffins
recipes.instructions: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Line a muffin tin with paper liners and grease with nonstick cooking spray. Set aside. In medium bowl, whisk together flour, corn meal, baking powder and salt. Set aside.In a large bowl, mash banana with a fork, then whisk in eggs, oil, milk and vanilla. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture, being careful not to over mix.Fold in berries, just until combined. Portion out into the muffin tin, filling about 3/4 full. Top each with 1 Tablespoon of sliced almonds.Bake until golden brown and a toothpick comes out clean, about 15-20 minutes.Once cooled, muffins can be stored in a resealable bag or container and placed in the freezer. Will keep for 1 month frozen.Enjoy!

steps.step: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Line a muffin tin with paper liners and grease with nonstick cooking spray. Set aside. In medium bowl, whisk together flour, corn meal, baking powder and salt. Set aside.In a large bowl, mash banana with a fork, then whisk in eggs, oil, milk and vanilla. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture, being careful not to over mix.Fold in berries, just until combined. Portion out into the muffin tin, filling about 3/4 full. Top each with 1 Tablespoon of sliced almonds.

Bake until golden brown and a toothpick comes out clean, about 15-20 minutes.Once cooled, muffins can be stored in a resealable bag or container and placed in the freezer. Will keep for 1 month frozen.Enjoy!
